speed.overview.title: Overview
speed.overview.headline: Monitor how your zone is performing over the past 24 hours, and view suggestions on how it can be improved. |||| Monitor how your zone is performing over the past %{days} days, and view suggestions on how it can be improved.
speed.tab.optimization.argo_promotion.ti: Deliver web assets 30% faster on average
speed.tab.optimization.argo_promotion.bo: Improve load times, avoid network traffic congestion, and reduce bandwidth usage with Argo Smart Routing.
amp.description:
Enable Accelerated Mobile Links to enhance your mobile visitor’s experience for external content. Accelerated Mobile Links allow your users to open external AMP links from your website in AMP. [AMP](https://ampproject.org/) makes your website’s mobile experience at least three times faster than normal.

**NOTE:** Enabling this option will apply to your entire domain. Alternatively, you can enable this option per subdomain by selecting from the drop down.
amp.help:
#### What is Accelerated Mobile Links?
Accelerated Mobile Links allow your users to open outgoing AMP links from your website in AMP. AMP is an open source project that uses a stricter flavor of HTML and very little Javascript so that your browser can load web pages on mobile browsers quickly. This is at least three times faster than a regular webpage and gives you a native mobile experience.
#### Additional Resources:
* [Accelerated Mobile Links](https://www.cloudflare.com/website-optimization/accelerated-mobile-links)
* [AMP](https://www.ampproject.org/)
* [Case studies around AMP](https://www.ampproject.org/case-studies/)
amp.title: Enable Accelerated Mobile Links
amp.real_urls.title: AMP Real URL
amp.real_urls.body: Display your site’s actual URL on your AMP pages, instead of the traditional Google AMP cache URL.
amp.real_urls.help:
### What does AMP Real URL do?

Traditionally, clicking on a search result for an AMP page takes visitors to a cached page served from google.com/amp/. AMP Real URL allows mobile browsers to show your site’s actual URL while still serving the content from Google’s AMP cache. This is accomplished through cryptographic signed exchanges. AMP Real URL only works on pages that are compatible with the AMP specification and only applies to visitors coming from Chrome on Android at this time. As the underlying technology gets adopted by more browsers, more visitors to your site will be able to view your real URL.

Showing the actual URL offers several advantages:

* Brand fidelity - Site visitors see your brand, not Google’s, at the top of all your pages.
* More accurate analytics - Keeping AMP and non-AMP content in the same domain facilitates more accurate analytics attribution.
* Reduced bounce rates - Showing your actual URL may encourage users to remain on your site, instead of returning to the search results page.
* Security - AMP Real URL uses cryptography to sign your AMP pages with a publicly verifiable certificate, ensuring no one can add, remove, or modify your content.

### How do I see it working?

After the feature is enabled, it takes the Google AMP Cache about a week to detect and serve the new URL. Simply visit your AMP pages from Google search results from Android Chrome and you should be able to see your actual URL. You can also go to [https://%{zoneName}/cdn-fpw/sxg/cert.pem.msg](https://%{zoneName}/cdn-fpw/sxg/cert.pem.msg) to verify that the feature is working. If the page does not 404 and prompts you to download a certificate, then you're all set!
brotli.description: Speed up page load times for your visitor's HTTPS traffic by applying Brotli compression.
brotli.deprecated.toast: The Brotli setting will be removed on 2024-08-15. After this date, Brotli compression will be enabled by default.
brotli.help: Cloudflare applies Brotli compression to help speed up page load times for your visitors. Cloudflare will select Brotli compression as the preferred content encoding method if multiple compression methods are supported by the client. If the client does not indicate that Brotli compression is supported, then gzip compression will be applied. [What will Cloudflare compress?](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200168396)
brotli.title: Brotli
http2_prioritization.title: Enhanced HTTP/2 Prioritization
http2_prioritization.description: Optimizes the order of resource delivery, independent of the browser. Greatest improvements will be experienced by visitors using Safari and Edge browsers.
http2_prioritization.help:
### What does Enhanced HTTP/2 Prioritization do?

The speed of loading web content, from the user's perspective, is dependent on the order in which the resources load. With HTTP/2, by default, Cloudflare will follow the order requested by the browser. This ordering varies from browser to browser, causing a significant difference in performance. 

With Enhanced HTTP/2 Prioritization enabled, resources will be  delivered in the optimal order for the fastest experience across all browsers. Read more about it on our [blog post.](https://blog.cloudflare.com/better-http-2-prioritization-for-a-faster-web/)
first_party_fonts.title: Cloudflare Fonts
first_party_fonts.description: Optimize font loading. Cloudflare Fonts reduces external requests for third-party fonts, resulting in improved privacy and performance for faster page loads.
first_party_fonts.help:
Cloudflare Fonts will inline Google Fonts styles directly in your HTML page to prevent fetching them from Google servers. It will also cache the fonts themselves on Cloudflare edge to reduce latency. 

Refer to the [Troubleshooting](https://developers.cloudflare.com/speed/optimization/content/fonts/troubleshooting/) section for more information.
image_resize.card.description:
You can resize, adjust quality, and convert images to WebP format, on demand. We cache every derived image at the edge, so you store only the original image.

This allows you to adapt images to your site’s layout and your visitors’ screen sizes, quickly and easily, without maintaining a server-side image processing pipeline.
image_resize.card.description.transforma:
Transform images from anywhere on the web. Every transformed variant is cached at the edge, so you store only the original image on your server.

Transformations are available as part of Cloudflare Images to let you optimize and manipulate images that aren’t stored in Images.

Transform images from anywhere on the web. Every transformed variant is cached at the edge, so you store only the original image on your server.

This lets you easily adapt images to your site’s layout and your visitors’ screen sizes without maintaining a server-side image processing pipeline.
image_resize.card.info_label: We recently introduced a new pricing model that lets you estimate your costs more predictably and easily. Get started by <0>switching to our new Images plan</0>.
image_resize.card.info_label.enterprise: We recently introduced a new pricing model that lets you estimate your costs more predictably and easily. To get started, contact your Customer Service Manager.
image_resize.card.help:
#### What does Image Resizing do?

Resizing fetches the original image and caches it (following the usual rules of HTTP caching, Cache-Control header, etc.). Requests for multiple different image sizes are likely to reuse the cached original image, without causing extra transfers from the origin server.

Resized images follow the same caching rules as the original image and their Cache-Control header is identical. We do not support purging of resized variants.  Purging of the original image URL will also purge all of its resized variants.

#### What does 'Resize images from any origin' do? 

 'Resize images from any origin' will allow Image Resizing to resize images from any URI.
I.e. %{zone} will serve resized images originating from any URI, whether %{zone} or elsewhere.

By default, Image Resizing will only resize images which originate from this zone, %{zone}.
I.e. %{zone} will serve resized images only if the images originate from %{zone}.

 #### Using Workers 

'Resize images from any origin' is not valid when using a Worker for Image Resizing. The Worker is expected to apply its own policies dictating which images will be resized.

[Image Resizing documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/)
image_resize.card.transformations.help:
#### Image Transformations

Image Transformations fetches the original image and caches it (following the usual rules of HTTP caching, Cache-Control header, etc.). Requests for multiple different image sizes are likely to reuse the cached original image, without causing extra transfers from the origin server.

Transformed images follow the same caching rules as the original image and their Cache-Control header is identical. We do not support purging of resized variants.  Purging of the original image URL will also purge all of its resized variants.

#### What does 'Resize images from any origin' do? 

 'Resize images from any origin' will allow Image Transformations to transform images from any URI.
I.e. %{zone} will serve resized images originating from any URI, whether %{zone} or elsewhere.

By default, Image Transformations will only resize images which originate from this zone, %{zone}.
I.e. %{zone} will serve resized images only if the images originate from %{zone}.

 #### Using Workers 

'Resize images from any origin' is not valid when using a Worker for Image Transformations. The Worker is expected to apply its own policies dictating which images will be resized.

[Image Transformations documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/)
image_resize.card.title: Image Transformations

mirage2.description: Improve load time for pages that include images on mobile devices with slow network connections.
mirage2.deprecation: [Mirage will be deprecated](https://developers.cloudflare.com/speed/optimization/images/mirage/) on September 15, 2025 and is no longer available to enable on zones. We recommend using the native loading attribute in HTML to [lazy load your images](https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/tutorials/optimize-mobile-viewing/).
mirage2.help:
#### What does Mirage do?
[Mirage tailors image loading](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/219178057) based on network connection and device type. Devices with small screens receive smaller images, and slower connections receive lower resolution images. This speeds up page rendering so users can begin interacting with your website without waiting for images to download first.

Mirage improves page load time by:

- **Image Virtualizing:** Replaces images with low resolution placeholder images that have the same dimensions as the original (including third party images). Once the page renders completely, full resolution images are then lazy-loaded (prioritizing images in the browser viewport). This process allows pages to render quickly and minimizes browser reflow.

- **Request Streamlining:** Combines multiple individual network requests for images into a single request.

**Note:** Mirage does not transcode or otherwise alter the original full-resolution images.

*Mirage is considered **Beta** because it’s an experimental feature that may cause issues displaying images in association with certain Javascript libraries, such as image carousels or photo viewers. Issues with Mirage affect only a small percentage of customers.*
mirage2.title: Mirage
performance.description: Manage performance settings for your website
performance.title: Speed
polish.description:
Improve image load time by optimizing images hosted on your domain. Optionally, the WebP image codec can be used with supported clients for additional performance benefits.

**Note**: Purge cache to have your change take effect immediately.
polish.help:
#### What does Polish do?
Polish reduces image file size by removing metadata (date and time, camera manufacturer and model, etc.), and by compressing images when possible. Smaller file sizes mean faster load times for images and web pages.
#### What Polish setting should I use?

 - **Off:** Polish is disabled
 - **Lossless:** Reduce the size of image files without impacting visual quality
   - Remove metadata: PNG, GIF, JPEG
   - Lossless compression: GIF, PNG
 - **Lossy:** In addition to the features included in the Basic level, the file size of JPEG images is reduced using lossy compression, which may reduce visual quality
   - Lossy compression: JPEG
 - **Serve WebP images:** When the client requesting the image supports the WebP image codec, Cloudflare will serve a WebP version of the image when WebP offers a performance advantage over the original image format.
   - Lossy compression: JPEG
   - Lossless compression: GIF, PNG
 **Note:** Large JPEG images are converted to progressive images. Visitors will see an increasingly detailed image as the file is downloaded.
polish.benefits.title: How Polish optimizes images
polish.title: Polish
prefetch_preload.description: Cloudflare will prefetch any URLs included in the prefetch HTTP header
prefetch_preload.help:
#### What does Prefetching do?
This feature allows Cloudflare to ensure that we have cached objects ready for your users when they make a request. Prefetch serves them at once, versus making separate requests for each object.

[We do this by prefetching the files](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/206776707) listed in a manifest file.  The manifest file is returned in an HTTP response header with the rel=”prefetch” attribute. The manifest file tells Cloudflare what to load into our cache to ensure that those files are delivered as quickly as possible. This can be helpful if your page has multiple, large assets that you want to serve from cache.

Example Prefetch HTTP header:
`Link: <http://www.example.com/manifest.txt>; rel="prefetch"`

Example manifest.txt:
`/static/fetch1`
`//other.example.com/fetch2`
`http://another.example.com/fetch3`

The manifest file should contain URIs, protocol-relative URLs or full URLs, separated by new lines. These files must be on your websites that are on Cloudflare.
prefetch_preload.title: Prefetch URLs
preloader.description: The preloader will automatically preload static resources for your web pages, resulting in much faster load times. The preloader quietly runs in the background after the first page load, pre-caching up to 50 of your most popular items. Those resources will be on hand before your visitors even ask for them. Uses the Cloudflare Toolkit which requires Javascript.
preloader.title: Website preloader
priority_hints.title: Priority Hints
railgun.description:
Accelerate delivery of dynamic content.

**Note:** Requires software installation at your host.
railgun.dialog.confirm_on_disabled_railg: Railgun ‘%{railgun}’, is not currently active. You can connect ‘%{railgun}’ to %{website}, but you will not receive Railgun’s benefits until the ‘%{railgun}’ becomes active
railgun.dialog.test.description.error: Railgun ‘%{railgun}’ is not configured properly to accelerate %{website}. Please make sure Railgun is configured properly.
railgun.dialog.test.description.success: %{website} is successfully connected to Railgun %{railgun}! This website is now accelerated by Railgun.
railgun.dialog.test.title: Railgun test results for ‘%{railgun}’
railgun.help:
#### What is Railgun?
When content is rapidly changing or is personalized, it cannot be cached in the traditional sense and requests must be sent to the origin server for processing. Visitors located far from the origin are impacted by these delays to a greater degree.

Railgun accelerates and secures delivery of dynamic content, through compression and WAN network optimization of communication between Cloudflare data centers and an origin server, speeding up requests that can’t be served directly from Cloudflare cache.

Railgun improves page load time by:

- Compressing content by tracking differences between page versions (down to the byte), only sending the parts that have actually changed.
- Maintaining a single persistent connection for multiple simultaneous requests, eliminating network connection latency.
- Caching dynamic content that changes frequently or is personalized.

![Cloudflare Railgun](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/XrM5P6EHhfl7tRgJhdRCiTLBu3gc4cE2lCWwxCrp34vNf_JHPWZoa-CfovkSZb1Q4r9XWUC--Zs24nfaeWkhzyhFQuGkopjva-YNcM-7COE081I35h9b9FuT_E7QPvt-uA)

#### What is the Railgun Listener?
Railgun consists of two software components: the Listener and the Sender. The Railgun Sender is installed in all Cloudflare data centers, and maintains connections with Railgun Listeners.

The Railgun Listener is installed within your origin network, usually at your web host. It’s a small piece of software that runs on a standard server, and services requests from Cloudflare using the encrypted, binary Railgun protocol.
railgun.none_available: No Railguns available. Please click the ‘%{button}’ button to add a Railgun.
railgun.select_railgun_before_enabling: You must select a Railgun before you can enable it.
railgun.table.name: Name
railgun.title: Railgun™
railgun.api.title.get_zones: Get zones connected to a Railgun
rocket_loader.description: Improve the paint time for pages which include JavaScript.
rocket_loader.help:
#### What does Rocket Loader do?
[Rocket Loader improves paint times](https://developers.cloudflare.com/speed/optimization/content/rocket-loader/) for pages that include Javascript. Visitors will have a better experience by seeing content load faster and speed is also a factor in some search rankings.

Rocket Loader improves paint times by asynchronously loading your Javascripts, including third party scripts, so that they do not block rendering the content of your pages.
rocket_loader.title: Rocket Loader™
speed.automatic_platform_optimization.wo: Improve the performance of your WordPress site. Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress serves your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network and caches third party fonts. Get the benefits of a static site without any changes to how you manage your site. This results in consistent, fast TTFB and content loading faster.
Learn more in our <0>announcement blog post for APO</0>.

**Note:** APO runs against the following list of hostnames:
_%{hostnames}_
Improve performance for your WordPress website by serving your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network.
speed.automatic_platform_optimization.de: Improve performance for your WordPress website by serving your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network.
speed.automatic_platform_optimization.wo: To enable Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress, <0>purchase the subscription</0> or <1>upgrade</1> to the Pro plan.
To enable Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress, purchase the subscription or upgrade to the Pro plan. It requires Super Admin, Admin or Billing role.
**Note:** The WordPress plugin was not detected on %{zone}.
**Note:** Changing Cache By Device Type setting will invalidate Cache.
**Note:** This optimization is only available for websites using WordPress. We did not detect WordPress running for %{zone}.
For more information about how APO provides better performance to your WordPress site, see <0>this support article</0>.
sxg.card.body: Improve your website's performance by making cacheable resources available on Google’s Signed Exchanges. Enable Chromium based browsers to prefetch your website on Google's search results page and make your website faster. Improve the Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) which is part of the Core Web Vitals and increase your SEO ranking.
sxg.card.help: **Signed HTTP exchanges** are an open, standard delivery mechanism that make it possible to authenticate the origin of a resource, independent of how it was delivered. This decoupling enables a variety of use cases, such as prefetching, offline Internet experiences, and serving from third-party caches. It does so in a secure and privacy-preserving manner, and Cloudflare automatically handles all packaging and certificate handling. [Learn more](https://blog.cloudflare.com/automatic-signed-exchanges)
sxg.card.help2:
### What are the requirements for enabling SXGs?

* SXGs are available for zones with a Pro or higher plan. SXGs are also available for zones on a Free plan with an APO subscription. 
* SXGs only works with zones that have their nameservers managed by Cloudflare. Learn [here how to change your domain nameservers](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/full-setup) to Cloudflare. After enabling your nameservers to be managed by Cloudflare, [log in to the Cloudflare dashboard](https://dash.cloudflare.com/), select your domain and go to DNS. In Proxy status, enable the Cloudflare proxy in any relevant DNS records by clicking the grey clouds. When proxied through Cloudflare, the cloud will be orange.
* Zone certificates need to be managed by Cloudflare.
	* **Note**: To obtain an SXG certificate, you need to add a CAA Record for issuance of the certificate from the Certificate Authority. Cloudflare adds the corresponding CAA records in DNS on behalf of users after they enable SXGs, to make sure issuance is not blocked. If you would like to obtain SSL certificates that are issued by other CAs, please ensure that you add the CAA records for the CAs after enabling the SXG.
* Content needs to be cached in intervals of 120 seconds or longer, as Google checks this setting to generate an SXG. To ensure that content is cached every two minutes or more, go to the `Cloudflare dashboard > Caching > Configuration > Browser Cache TTL` and check the length of time Cloudflare instructs a browser to cache files. 
* AMP Real URL needs to be disabled if SXGs is enabled. To do that, go to the `Cloudflare dashboard > Speed > Optimization > AMP Real URL` and click the toggle to disable this setting.

### Limitations

* Currently, signed exchanges are only used by Google for Android search. Google is working on implementing support for SXGs on desktop browsers.
* Google only loads Signed Exchanges for the top results.
* Signed exchanges can strip out certain cookies and headers, and create problems with dynamic content. The following hop-by-hop and other uncached headers will be stripped during the signed exchange generation:
	1. Hop-by-hop header fields listed in the Connection header field ([Section 6.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7230#section-6.1) of [RFC7230](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7230)).
	2. Header fields listed in the no-cache response directive in the Cache-Control header field ([Section 5.2.2.2](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7234#section-5.2.2.2) of [RFC7234](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7234)).
	3. Header fields defined as hop-by-hop:
		* `Connection`, `Keep-Alive`, `Proxy-Connection Trailer`, `Transfer-Encoding`, `Upgrade`
* Since Cloudflare cannot be sure whether a signed exchange does or does not include private information, a signed exchange will not be generated in the presence of the following headers:
	* `Authentication-Control`, `Authentication-Info`, `Clear-Site-Data`, `Optional-WWW-Authenticate`, `Proxy-Authenticate`, `Proxy-Authentication-Info`, `Public-Key-Pins`, `Sec-WebSocket-Accept`, `Set-Cookie`, `Set-Cookie2`, `SetProfile`, `Strict-Transport-Security`, `Vary`, `WWW-Authenticate`

### FAQs

* [In this page](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/4411386879629-Automatic-Signed-Exchanges-SXGs-Beta-FAQ), you will find the answers to the most commonly asked questions regarding Automatic Signed Exchanges.
sxg.card.note_fullzone: **Note**: This functionality is available for the domains proxied through Cloudflare. Please ensure that the proxy status is set to Cloudflare (orange cloud).
sxg.card.note_partialzone: **Note**: This functionality is only available for zones using Cloudflare Nameservers with orange clouded DNS records (Cloudflare proxy turned on). To change your domain nameservers, please follow the instructions in this [article](https://developers.cloudflare.com/dns/zone-setups/full-setup). Then, turn on the Cloudflare proxy (orange cloud) for any relevant DNS record.
sxg.card.title: Automatic Signed Exchanges (SXGs)
speed.earlyhints.card_description: Cloudflare's edge will cache and send 103 Early Hints responses with Link headers from your HTML pages. Early Hints allows browsers to preload linked assets before they see a 200 OK or other final response from the origin.
speed.earlyhints.card_help:
103 Early Hints is an HTTP status code designed to speed up content delivery. When enabled, Cloudflare can cache the Link headers marked with preload and/or preconnect from HTML pages and serve them in a 103 Early Hints response before reaching the origin server. Browsers can use these hints to fetch linked assets while waiting for the origin's final response, dramatically improving page load speeds.

Please see the [feature docs](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/advanced-configuration/early-hints/) and [announcement blog](https://blog.cloudflare.com/early-hints) for more information.
speed.speed_brain.card_description: Speed Brain speeds up page load times by leveraging the Speculation Rules API. This instructs browsers to make speculative prefetch requests as a way to speed up next page navigation loading time.
speed.speed_brain.card_disabled: **NOTE:** Speed Brain is currently in Beta testing. Even when enabled, it might not be actively running at all times on your website.
speed.speed_brain.card.rum_enabled: Go to <0>Real User Measurements</0> to view the real user experience on your website and the impact of Speed Brain.
speed.speed_brain.card.rum_disabled: We recommend enabling <0>Real User Measurements</0> when using Speed Brain. This will allow you to measure the real user experience on your website and the impact of Speed Brain.

speed.test.detail.failed.redirect.p1: It might have failed because your test URL <0>%{url}</0> was redirected to a different domain.

speed.test.histogram.tooltip.label: %{percentile}% experienced %{metric} below:
speed.test.histogram.caption: Network test histogram of %{metric} for %{label} with the total of %{numDatapoints} data points with %{percentileList} highlighted
speed.upgrade_card.title: Run recurring tests more frequently
speed.upgrade_card.description: Upgrade to a paid plan to get access to more frequent recurring test.
speed.detail.tabs.trend.headline: Trend
speed.detail.tabs.trend.description: Trend shows the result of score and metrics over time for you to easily track the website performance.
speed.test.detail.in_progress_toast: Test is in progress and will finish %{fromNow}. To see latest data, <0>refresh the page</0>.
speed.test.detail.recommendations.descri: Lighthouse identified the below opportunities. Check the following recommendations to improve your web performance.
speed.test.detail.rum_recommendations.de: Using the real user measurements from your site traffic over the past 24 hours, Cloudflare found the following recommendations to improve your web performance.
speed.test.detail.recommendations.empty: Your website is in a good state. No recommendation available right now.
speed.recommendation.title: Recommendation
speed.recommendation.proxy.description: This allows Cloudflare to optimize, cache, and protect all requests to your application, as well as protect your origin server from DDoS attacks. <0>Learn more about Proxy status</0>.
speed.recommendation.rocket_loader.upsel: Defer your JS until your page has fully loaded with Rocket Loader.
speed.recommendation.rocket_loader.descr: Rocket Loader prioritizes your website’s content (text, images, fonts, and more) by deferring the loading of all of your JavaScript until after rendering. <0>Learn more about Rocket Loader</0>.
speed.recommendation.images.title: Images
speed.recommendation.polish.upsell: Compress and encode your images more effectively.
speed.recommendation.polish.description: Polish strips metadata from images and reduces image size through lossy or lossless compression to accelerate the speed of image downloads. <0>Learn more about Polish</0>.
speed.recommendation.argo.upsell: Speed up your global traffic with a single click.
speed.recommendation.argo.description: Argo uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network for an average 35% decrease in latency, 27% decrease in connection errors, and 60% decrease in cache misses. <0>Learn more about Argo</0>.
speed.recommendation.zaraz.upsell: Dramatically reduce the impact of third-party code.
speed.recommendation.zaraz.description: Zaraz loads third-party tools in the cloud, away from browsers, improving speed, security, and privacy. <0>Learn more about Zaraz</0>.
speed.recommendation.cache_rules.name: Cache Rules
speed.recommendation.cache_rules.descrip: Cache Rules customize cache properties of your HTTP requests. <0>Learn more about Cache Rules</0>.
speed.test.detail.rum.headline: Real user measurements
speed.test.detail.rum.description: Real user measurements show the end users experience on your website.
speed.test.detail.rum.map.headline: %{metric} by country
speed.test.detail.rum.map.empty: No data available.<0></0>Check back after more visitors have visited your website.
speed.test.detail.rum.failed.headline: Request failed
speed.test.detail.rum.failed.description: We could not request RUM data at this time.<0></0>Try again or contact Cloudflare customer support if the issue persists.
speed.test.detail.rum.disabled.descripti: Real user measurements show the end users experience on your website. Enable RUM to capture the real user experience on your website and compare the data from the speed test.
speed.test.detail.rum.disabled.enable.de: Enable RUM for free to view the real user data.
speed.test.detail.rum.disabled.enable.su: You have enabled Real User Measurements (RUM) successfully. It typically takes no more than five minutes to see the data coming in, however, it varies depending on traffic conditions.
speed.test.detail.rum_recommendations.tt: Poor TTFB for the LCP element
The LCP element on this page has a sub-optimal <0>TTFB</0>.

Speed up your global traffic with a single click. 

Argo uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network for an average 35% decrease in latency, 27% decrease in connection errors, and 60% decrease in cache misses. <0>Learn more about Argo.</0>
speed.test.detail.rum_recommendations.rl: Poor Resource Load Delay for the LCP element
The LCP element on this page has a sub-optimal <0>resource load delay</0>.

Let browsers know the priority of the LCP element. 

Boost the priority of the LCP image by specifying <0>fetchpriority="high"</0> on the LCP element, causing LCP to happen sooner.
Poor Resource Load Time for the LCP element
The LCP element on this page has a sub-optimal <0>resource load time</0>.

Reduce the load time of your LCP image.

Polish strips metadata from images and reduces image size through lossy or lossless compression to accelerate the speed of image downloads.
speed.detail.metric.ttfb.description: TTFB measures the time between the request for a resource and when the first byte of a response begins to arrive.
speed.detail.metric.fcp.description: FCP measures the time from when the page starts loading to when any part of the page's content is rendered on the screen.
speed.detail.metric.lcp.description: LCP reports the render time of the largest image or text block visible within the viewport.
speed.detail.metric.tti.description: TTI metric measures the time from when the page starts loading to when its main sub-resources have loaded and it is capable of reliably responding to user input quickly.
speed.detail.metric.tbt.description: TBT measures the total amount of time between First Contentful Paint (FCP) and Time to Interactive (TTI) where the main thread was blocked for long enough to prevent input responsiveness.
speed.detail.metric.si.description: Speed Index measures how quickly content is visually displayed during page load.
speed.detail.metric.cls.description: CLS is a measure of the largest burst of layout shift scores for every unexpected layout shift that occurs during the entire lifespan of a page.
speed.detail.metric.inp.description: INP measures page responsiveness, how long it takes the page to visibly respond to user input.
speed.errors.invalid_region: This region cannot be selected for this test type.
speed.errors.invalid_frequency: This frequency cannot be selected for this test type.
speed.errors.monthly_test_quota_exceeded: You have exceeded your monthly quota.
speed.errors.scheduled_test_already_exis: This scheduled Speed test already exists.
speed.errors.test_not_found: Your Speed test could not be found.
speed.errors.zone_not_created: Your Zone does not exist. Speed tests require an existing Zone.

speed.overview.modal.title: Welcome to Observatory
speed.overview.modal.monitor_performance: Enable Real User Monitoring to anonymously capture browser and network performance. <0>Learn more about RUM</0>
speed.overview.modal.schedule_tests.desc: Simulate user activity to track the performance of your most important paths and endpoints over time
speed.overview.modal.get_suggestions.des: Receive suggestions on how to improve your application's performance
speed.overview.modal.enable_success: Real User Monitoring enabled. Performance data will display as it becomes available.
speed.overview.rum.settings.dismissable_: View core web vitals and network performance data by enabling Real User Monitoring (RUM). <0>Open RUM settings</0>
speed.overview.section.suggestions.title: Suggestions
speed.overview.section.suggestions.empty: You're all set! No further recommendations at this time.
speed.insights.empty.title: No suggestions for the selected filters
speed.insights.empty.description: Choose another filter, or new suggestions will appear here as necessary.
speed.insights.polish_not_enabled.title: Reduce Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) by enabling Polish
speed.insights.polish_not_enabled.card.t: Reduce Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) with Polish
speed.insights.polish_not_enabled.descri: Resource load duration is the time spent downloading images. When it exceeds 10% of your LCP for P75 of traffic, you should consider compressing resources. <0>Learn more about LCP</0>
speed.insights.polish_not_enabled.subhea: Resource load duration is exceeding 10% of your Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) for 75% of your traffic
speed.insights.polish_not_enabled.action:
Improve image load time by optimizing images hosted on your domain. Optionally, the WebP image codec can be used with supported clients for additional performance benefits. <0>Learn more about Polish.

To enable Polish, press the 'Go to Image Optimization' button below. Under 'Polish', select Lossy or Lossless from the drop-down menu.

The lossy option applies significantly better compression to images than the lossless option, at a cost of small quality loss.
speed.overview.section.insights.argo_sma: Reduce TTFB by enabling Argo Smart Routing
speed.insights.argo_smart_routing_not_en: Reduce TTFB with Argo Smart Routing
Reduce TTFB by enabling Argo Smart Routing
Your time-to-first-byte (TTFB) is exceeding 800ms for 75% of your traffic

TTFB measures the time between when a request is first made and when the first byte of a response begins to arrive to the visitor. A slow TTFB means that visitors to your domain may be experiencing higher response times. This can be caused by multiple factors, such as your origin server handling a high volume of requests, or network congestion.
Accelerate traffic by enabling Argo Smart Routing in Smart Shield

Argo Smart Routing detects real-time network issues and routes your web traffic across the most efficient network path. This results in faster loading times, increased reliability, and reduced costs. <0>Learn more about Argo Smart Routing.

Press the 'Go to Smart Shield' button below, then activate Argo Smart Routing by enabling its toggle.
speed.insights.smart_tiered_cache.title: Increase your cache hit ratio with Smart Shield
speed.insights.smart_tiered_cache.card.t: Increase your cache hit ratio with Smart Shield
speed.insights.smart_tiered_cache.subhea: You may be serving more traffic from your origin than necessary
speed.insights.smart_tiered_cache.descri: Your origin server could be handling fewer cache requests overall. Improving your cache hit ratio can result in increased performance for your application, decreased operational costs for your origin and lower security risks.
speed.insights.smart_tiered_cache.action: Increase your cache hit ratio with Smart Shield's Smart Tiered Cache

Smart Tiered Cache acts as an intermediate caching layer between Cloudflare’s network and your origin server. This feature efficiently reduces traffic to your origin by introducing a dynamic upper tier for cached assets, meaning you’ll save on egress costs without sacrificing performance and availability. <0>Learn more about Smart Tiered Cache.

Press the 'Go to Smart Shield' button below, then press 'Get started' to begin using Smart Shield's Smart Tiered Cache.
speed.insights.health_checks.title: Fix 5XX errors quicker by creating your first health check
speed.insights.health_checks.card.title: Fix 5XX errors quicker by creating your first health check
speed.insights.health_checks.subhead: You do not have any origin server health notifications configured
speed.insights.health_checks.description: Consistent origin server instability can result in increased 5xx errors, in turn signaling a possible problem with your origin. Being notified of increased occurrences of 5xx errors earlier can help you identify problems with your origin server faster.
speed.insights.health_checks.action_subh: Create your first standalone Health Check to monitor your origin for 5XX error codes
speed.insights.health_checks.action_desc:
Health checks offer real-time notifications of problems with origin servers or applications, including 5XX errors. Use analytics to evaluate endpoint uptime, latency, failure reason, and specific event logs to debug possible endpoint issues. <0>Learn more about health checks.

Press the 'Go to Smart Shield' button below, then press 'Get Started' next to Health Checks.
speed.overview.card.ttlb_breakdown.toolt: TTLB breakdown measures each component of the time between when the request is first made and when the last byte of a response arrives. The metrics shown are for P75.
speed.synthetic_monitoring.table.select_: Select 2 URLs to compare the most recent results
Trend shows the result of score and metrics over time for you to easily track your endpoints response times.
speed.synthetic_monitoring.warning.max_c: The maximum number of tests you can compare is two. Please update your selection.
speed.rum.title: Real User Monitoring
speed.rum.description: Metrics of real visitors to your zone, showing the end user experience on your website
speed.web_vitals.core.lcp.tooltip.descri: LCP measures the render time of the largest image or text block visible within the viewport.
speed.web_vitals.core.lcp.tooltip.experi: To the user, LCP is the perceived load time and marks the point where the main content has loaded.
speed.web_vitals.core.inp.tooltip.descri: INP measures a page's overall responsiveness to user interactions by observing the latency of all click, tap, and keyboard interactions.
speed.web_vitals.core.inp.tooltip.experi: A good INP indicates a fast, fluid user experience.
speed.web_vitals.core.cls.tooltip.descri: CLS measures the largest burst of layout shift scores for every unexpected shift that occurs during the lifespan of a page.
speed.web_vitals.core.cls.tooltip.experi: CLS indicates the perceived visual stability of a page.
speed.web_vitals.ttfb.tooltip.descriptio: TTFB measures the time between when a request is first made and when the first byte of a response begins to arrive.
speed.web_vitals.ttfb.tooltip.experience: TTFB is a component of the perceived load time.
speed.metrics.network.ttlb.title: Time to Last Byte (TTLB) Breakdown
speed.metrics.network.ttlb.tooltip.descr: TTLB breakdown measures each component of the time between when the request is first made and when the last byte of a response arrives. The metrics shown are for P75
speed.metrics.network.dnsTime.tooltip.de: How long a Domain Name System (DNS) query takes. This could appear as zero for reused connections or content stored in the local cache.
speed.metrics.network.connectionTime.too: The time it takes to establish a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection with the server.
speed.metrics.network.tls.tooltip.descri: The latency introduced by the Transport Layer Security (TLS) handshake; the initial process of establishing a secure connection before encrypted data can be exchanged.
speed.metrics.network.requestTime.toolti: The time elapsed between making an HTTP request and receiving the first byte of the response.
speed.metrics.network.responseTime.toolt: The time elapsed between receiving the first byte of the response and last byte of the response.
speed.http_traffic.cache_hits.tooltip.de: The ratio between how much traffic is hitting Cloudflare's cache and traffic hitting your origin server. Traffic that hits the Cloudflare cache reduces the load on your origin server.
speed.http_traffic.origin_error_codes.to: Less errors can indicate the origin server is more reliable.
speed.http_traffic.edge_error_codes.tool: Error codes on the Edge may indicate the need to update your configuration.
speed.detail.metric.network.Dns.definiti: Measures the time it takes for a client to query a DNS server and get a response.
speed.detail.metric.network.Connect.defi: Measures the time it takes to establish a connection between the client (in the case of observatory Cloudflare's synthetic client) and the time it takes to establish a connection to a server on the network.
speed.detail.metric.network.Tls.definiti: Measures the duration of the TLS handshake process — the time spent establishing a secure connection between the client and the server using TLS.
speed.detail.metric.network.Wait.definit: Measures the delay a user experiences from initiating a request to receiving the response headers. This can include times that the first server and other servers behind it might take to collect and process the request and begin to transmit the response.
speed.detail.metric.network.Load.definit: Measures the total time it takes to download the complete response.
speed.detail.metric.network.ResponseTime: The total time it takes for both the DNS server and the HTTP server to process the request and response from when DNS resolution starts until the response has been fully received by the client. This is calculated as the sum of DNS, Connect, TLS, Wait, and Load
speed.detail.metric.network.ServerRespon: The total time it takes for the HTTP server to process the request and response from  when the establishment of a secure connection starts until the response has been fully received by the client. This is calculated as the sum of Connect, TLS, Wait, and Load.
speed.detail.metric.network.Ttfb.definit: The total time it takes for both the DNS server and the HTTP server to process the request from when DNS resolution starts until the client starts to receive the response. This is calculated as the sum of DNS, Connect, TLS, and Wait.
speed.detail.metric.network.ServerTtfb.d: The total time it takes the HTTP server to process the request from when the establishment of a secure connection starts until the client starts receiving the response. This is calculated as the sum of Connect, TLS, and Wait.
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.card.title: Get started with Smart Shield
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.card.image:
Protect your origin with
Smart Shield
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.card.subti: Steps: %{numberOfSteps} | Est. time to complete: 4 minutes
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.card.descr: In this path, you will configure Cloudflare's features that optimize how your cache is managed and how traffic is routed. These features reduce the load on your origin server, and allow your content to be delivered faster.
speed.smart_shield.description: Protect your origin server, improve content availability and reduce network latency.
speed.smart_shield.toast.downgraded_pack: Your %{planName} package has been cancelled on this domain. The %{planName} package's features will remain available to you until %{endDate}. After this date, your origin server will still be secured by Smart Shield's free features.
speed.smart_shield.recommendations.healt: Monitor origin health by setting up a health check.
speed.smart_shield.upgrade.description: For more Smart Shield products, upgrade your plan.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.descri: View and manage your Smart Shield settings.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.health: Get real-time notifications of problems with an IP address or hostname for endpoints or applications.
Evaluate endpoint uptime, latency, failure reason, and specific event logs to debug possible endpoint issues.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.argo_s: If you disable Argo Smart Routing for %{zoneName}, latency will increase from **%{latency}ms** to **%{latencyIncrease}ms** and %{zoneName} will be **%{decrease}%** slower.
Your zone %{zoneName} will be on average 30% slower if you disable Argo Smart Routing.
speed.smart_shield.health_checks.title: Health Checks
speed.smart_shield.health_checks.descrip: Get real-time notifications of problems with an IP address or hostname for endpoints or applications. Use analytics to evaluate endpoint uptime, latency, failure reason, and specific event logs to debug possible endpoint issues.
speed.smart_shield.smart_tiered_cache.co: Disabling Smart Tiered Cache will also disable Regional Tiered Cache and Cache Reserve here and in Caching.
speed.smart_shield.smart_tiered_cache.mo: Smart tiered cache divides Cloudflare's network of data centers into a lower and upper tier. Upper tier locations are the data centers that Cloudflare has identified to be optimal for your origin. View your assigned upper tier location per origin IP, noted in city codes below at any time. Your primary and failover data center locations might show the same city code because we often have multiple data centers in the same city.
We found %{total} origin IPs for this zone.
speed.smart_shield.cache_reserve.modal.t: Pause Cache Reserve using the toggle.
speed.smart_shield.cache_reserve.modal.d: Delete all data stored in Cache Reserve. In most cases, this takes around 24 hours. To purge your cache instead, use <0>Cache Purge.</0>
A deletion is already in progress.
Pause Cache Reserve to delete data
Usage from 1 Aug - 4 Aug for {{Zone Name}}
speed.smart_shield.error.loading_setting: There was an issue loading your Smart Shield settings. Please try again.
speed.smart_shield.landing.hero.title: Safeguard your origin with just a few clicks
speed.smart_shield.landing.hero.cta.fini: Finish your zone zone setup to access Smart Shield
speed.smart_shield.landing.about.title: About Smart Shield
speed.smart_shield.landing.about.descrip: Cloudflare's Smart Shield acts as an intermediate caching layer between our content delivery network's edge servers and your origin server. Its primary purpose is to consolidate multiple requests from various edge locations into a single request to the origin, thereby significantly reducing origin load.
speed.smart_shield.landing.features.cach: Improve cache hits through tiered caching
speed.smart_shield.landing.features.redu: Reduce costs by minimizing origin bandwidth
speed.smart_shield.landing.features.enha: Enhance security by limiting direct origin connections
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.title: Upgrade to get more from Smart Shield
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.title.s: Select a Smart Shield package for %{zoneName}
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.title.c: Need to change Smart Shield packages for %{zoneName}?
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.subtitl: To make a change to your current plan, contact your account team.

To make a change to your current plan, press the 'Go to billing' button below and cancel your current Smart Shield subscription. You can then purchase a different Smart Shield package at the start of your next billing cycle on %{endDate}.
speed.smart_shield.success.title: Success! Your origin is protected
speed.smart_shield.success.suggestions.o: See page and network metrics in Observatory.
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.plan.ba: Basic protection and performance for your origin.
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.plan.ar: Basic protection and enhanced performance for your origin with Argo Smart Routing.
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.plan.ad: Advanced protection and performance for your origin, including Argo Smart Routing and more caching customization.
speed.smart_shield.upgrade_modal.feature: *For Pro, Business, and Enterprise plans only.
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.step_enabl: Enable Smart Shield by turning on Smart Tiered Cache. This feature efficiently reduces traffic to your origin by introducing a dynamic upper tier for cached assets, meaning you'll save on egress costs without sacrificing performance and availability.
Learn more about Smart Tiered Cache

Minimize origin resource consumption by dividing our network of global data centers into a lower and upper tier. This allows Cloudflare to dynamically identify the optimal data centers that are closest to your origin(s).
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.step_conne: Connection reuse improves your origin’s performance and reduces egress costs by packaging multiple requests into a single connection. Connection reuse is always active once you set up your zone.
Reduces latency by allowing Cloudflare to package multiple requests into a single connection to the origin from your upper tier.
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.step_traff: Optionally speed up your traffic by instructing Cloudflare to send your traffic over the most efficient network path. Smart routing helps to avoid congestion and improves performance, especially for users farthest from your origin.
Learn more about Argo Smart Routing

Deliver responses to your users more quickly, reliably, and securely via optimized routes across the Cloudflare network, reducing Internet latency on average by more than 30% and connection errors by 27%.
speed.smart_shield.onboarding.step_addit: Optionally set up an additional regional tier for your cache, or opt in to store your cacheable files in our persistent storage for a longer duration.
Improve origin performance by instructing Cloudflare to check a regional data center near the lower tier before going to the upper tier that may be outside the region.

Improve origin performance by automatically storing all cacheable files into Cloudflare’s persistent object storage buckets that we check before going to your origin. Cached files are stored with a 30 day time-to-live (TTL) refreshed on cache hits.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.smart_: Dynamically identify the optimal data centers that are closest to your origin.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.region: Check a regional data center closer to the visitor before going to a data center that may be outside their region.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.cache_: Store cached files for longer in persistent buckets that we check before going to your origin.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.health: Monitor your origin and get real-time notifications of problems.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.argo_s: Automatically route traffic around network congestion for the fastest web experience.
speed.smart_shield.configurations.connec: Package multiple requests into a single connection from your upper tier to your origin to reduce latency.
